data.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
Hast thou been often spoken to in distress?
For whereas thou hast instructed many,
And hast supported the failing with words,
Yet now that pain has come upon thee, and touched thee, thou art troubled.
Is not thy fear founded in folly,
Remember then who has perished, being pure?
Accordingly as I have seen men plowing barren places,
They shall perish by the command of the Lord,
The strength of the lion, and the voice of the lioness,
The old lion has perished for want of food,
But if there had been any truth in thy words,
But as when terror falls upon men,
Horror and trembling seized me,
And a spirit came before my face;
I arose and perceived it not:
What, shall a mortal be pure before the Lord?
Whereas he trusts not in his servants,
But as for them that dwell in houses of clay,
And from morning to evening they no longer exist:
For he blows upon them, and they are withered:
